page.title: 01GOSPORT and PORTSMOUTH
page.content: {A View from both sides of the Water} Although geographically linked on the Ordnance Survey map, this area is divided by a stretch of water, Portsmouth Harbour. To the west lies Gosport, the original busy town and some of its suburbs. On the east side is part of the city of Portsmouth and Old Portsmouth itself. The main feature of our area is the Dockyard serving both Naval and commercial needs. There are Naval shore bases here, HMS Dolphin in Gosport and HMS Vernon in Portsmouth. There are regular crossings to France and the Channel Islands by a number of ferry services. The Isle of Wight, too is only a thirty minute trip away. Gosport and Portsmouth are linked by a ferry service taking about four minutes; the journey by road can take about one hour in heavy traffic!
